channel.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast
channel.itunes:summary: Bringing you a full reaction to all the weekends Barclays Premier League fixtures, including exclusive interviews with managers and players. Each week our presenter will be joined by a former player for their insight and analysis into the most exciting league in the world, as well as bringing you all the news on the very latest Barclays initiatives.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2013-14 - Season Review
item.itunes:summary: Everton manager Roberto Martinez joins Iain Dowie, Matt Jackson and Marcus Buckland for the final Barclays Premier League Podcast of the season to review what has been an incredible ten months of top flight football. The Toffees boss reflects on achieving the clubs highest points tally since they last won the league and tells us about the promising batch of youngsters coming through at Goodison Park. We analyse where the title was won and lost and get reaction from Manuel Pellegrini and Vincent Kompany after Manchester City were crowned Champions. Southampton legend Matt Le Tissier tells us about his love for the Saints fans. Plus we hear from Jose Mourinho, Ryan Giggs and Tony Pulis, and we will be conducting our very own end of season awards.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2013-14 - Episode 38
item.itunes:summary: Crystal Palace Chairman Steve Parish joins Dave Farrar and former Charlton and Ipswich midfielder Matt Holland to discuss the incredible comeback against Liverpool, which could decide the destination of the title. West Brom defender Steven Reid describes his relief at securing top flight football for another season, whilst Manchester United midfielder Darren Fletcher reveals the impact Ryan Giggs has had since taking the reins at Old Trafford. Plus we hear from Felix Magath and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer as Fulham and Cardiff become the first two sides to be relegated from the Barclays Premier League.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2013-14 - Episode 37
item.itunes:summary: Manchester United legend Bryan Robson and former Sunderland striker Kevin Phillips join Ed Chamberlin and Nigel Winterburn on this weeks show. Robson talks exclusively about his former team-mate Ryan Giggs new role as interim manager at Old Trafford and Phillips discusses his recent retirement following an illustrious career as well as his former clubs survival chances. We hear from PFA Award winners Luis Suarez and Eden Hazard, as well as Yaya Toure, Wilfried Bony and many more.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2013-14 - Episode 36
item.itunes:summary: David Moyes departure from Old Trafford is discussed by journalist Paddy Barclay as he joins Marcus Buckland and former Everton and Chelsea midfielder Graham Stuart. West Ham midfielder Mark Noble reveals which England star helped turn him into a fully fledged professional and a life long Crystal Palace fan joins us to marvel at the Tony Pulis Effect. We also hear from Brendan Rodgers, Jose Mourinho and Aaron Ramsey.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2013-14 - Episode 35
item.itunes:summary: Fulham captain Brede Hangeland joins Jacqui Oatley and former Liverpool and Tottenham defender John Scales to discuss Felix Magaths impact on the club after their crucial win over Norwich City. We hear from Steven Gerrard and Brendan Rodgers as they react to an emotional victory at Anfield against title rivals Manchester City. Former Tottenham skipper Gary Mabbutt explains the pressures of leading a top flight side in the Barclays Premier League. Plus we hear from John Terry, Christian Eriksen and many more.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2013-14 - Episode 33
item.itunes:summary: Liverpool legend Mark Lawrenson joins Jacqui Oatley and former Arsenal and West Ham midfielder Stewart Robson to reflect on an incredible Barclays Premier League weekend where the Reds moved to the top of the table. Jose Mourinho says Chelsea can no longer win the title and former Blues star Marcel Desailly tells us who he thinks will be crowned Champions in May. Manchester United reserve team coach, Nicky Butt explains how his experiences at Old Trafford are helping to develop young talent, plus we hear from Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, Peter Odemwingie and Rickie Lambert.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2013-14 - Episode 29
item.itunes:summary: Ed Chamberlin makes his Podcast debut alongside former West Ham, Southampton and Crystal Palace striker Iain Dowie, and together they look back at a dramatic weekend in the Barclays Premier League where Chelsea moved four points clear at the top. Stoke City Chairman Peter Coates joins us exclusively to explain how his side managed yet another win over Arsenal at the Britannia Stadium, whilst Aston Villa legend Ian Taylor discusses a wonder goal for Christian Benteke against Norwich City. Also on the show, John Barnes boards the Barclays Bus as Liverpool have a day to remember at Southampton, plus we speak to the blind West Brom fan who ran seven marathons in seven days in seven different continents!

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2013-14 - Episode 24
item.itunes:summary: Graham Stuart and Paddy Barclay join Marcus Buckland to discuss the end of a busy January Transfer Window which has seen Manchester United smash their club record to sign Juan Mata from Chelsea â€“ we hear from the Spaniard as well as from David Moyes and former United striker Dwight Yorke. We discuss all the other transfer news and hear from a delighted Everton manager Roberto Martinez after Leighton Baines signs a new four year contract at the club. We get the lowdown on Spurs manager Tim Sherwood from his former team-mate and title winner at Blackburn, Stuart Ripley. Along with Graham and Paddy, Everton legend, Graeme Sharp, gives us his nominations for the Barclays Merit Awards. Plus we hear from an 83-year-old zip-wiring Southampton super fan!

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2013-14 - Episode 18
item.itunes:summary: Newcastle midfielder Vernun Anita joins Dave Farrar and Graham Stewart to chat about his sideâ€™s historic win over Manchester United at Old Trafford. We also hear from both managers, David Moyes and Alan Pardew. The Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger talks to us about the cushion of having a five point lead at the top of the table, while the Liverpool manager Brendon Rogers pays further tribute to his in-form striker Luis Suarez. As well as that, we look back at the rest of the weekend's action and hear from all those involved including Jose Mourinho, Rene Meulensteen and Cameron Jerome.

item.itunes:summary: Everton Manager Roberto Martinez joins Alan Curbishley, journalist Jason Burt and Dave Farrar in a Managerâ€™s Special this week. item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast - 2013-14 - Episode 6
item.itunes:summary: Cardiff Manager Malkay Mackay joins Marcus Buckland and Matt Jackson to review another exciting weekend of Barclays Premier League action. It was a bitter sweet night for Swansea midfielder Jonjo Shelvey against his former club Liverpool on Monday night. We hear from the midfielder as well as his old manager Brendan Rodgers and John Hartson joins us to digest what was a dramatic evening at the Liberty Stadium. There were maiden home wins for David Moyes and Roberto Martinez. Plus we hear from Christian Eriksen, Gareth Barry and Hatem Ben Arfa.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast - 2013-14 - Episode 5
item.itunes:summary: Jacqui Oatley is joined by former Liverpool and Spurs defender John Scales and football journalist Paddy Barclay, as we take an in depth look at how Englands top flight is shaping up with Liverpool leading the way after three games. Crystal Palace defender Dean Moxey talks to us ahead of his teams trip to Old Trafford this weekend. Swansea Chairman Huw Jenkins explains how his players had to be brought back down to earth after last seasons heroics. We hear from Marouane Fellaini on his dream move, Theo Walcott on Arsenals record breaking signing, and Roberto Martinez on Evertons successful transfer business. And we speak exclusively to former Aston Villa and Celtic midfielder Stiliyan Petrov about his emotional fight against Leukaemia.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast - 2013-14 - Episode 4
item.itunes:summary: Alan Curbishley and Dave Farrar discuss a frenetic final day of transfer activity which saw Gareth Bale leave North London to become the worlds most expensive player and Mesut Ozil come the other way as he joined Arsenal in a club record deal. European Football Expert Gabrielle Marcotti talks us through all the other last minute comings and goings in the Transfer Window. We speak to former Liverpool manager Roy Evans as the Reds honoured the great Bill Shankly by beating their arch rivals Manchester United at Anfield. We talk to West Brom defender Steven Reid about their difficult start to the season. And we look back at all of the rest of the weekendâ€™s action, hearing from Olivier Giroud, Ian Holloway, Paolo Di Canio and many more

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast - 2013-14 - Season Preview
item.itunes:summary: Preview of the 2013/14 Barclays Premier League season. Dave Farrar is joined by two special guests, former Arsenal and West Ham midfielder, Stewart Robson, and ex Norwich and Nigeria striker, Efan Ekoku. Itâ€™s the first time in living memory that England's top three clubs begin their campaigns with a new manager. We hear from the three new men in charge, David Moyes at Manchester United, Manuel Pellegrini at Manchester City and a returning Jose Mourinho at Chelsea. Cardiff Cityâ€™s Ben Turner and Hull Cityâ€™s James Chester both join us to discuss their clubsâ€™ return to the top flight. European football expert Andy Brassall talks us through all the major transfer news in whatâ€™s been a summer of speculation. And we hear from Arsene Wenger, Roberto Martinez, Mark Hughes and Ryan Giggs among others.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast - 2013-14 Fixtures Special
item.itunes:summary: 2013/14 Fixture List Special - Marcus Buckland is joined by two very special guests, former Chelsea and Netherlands striker, Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink, and ex Arsenal and England midfielder, Ray Parlour. Together we discuss the recent release of the 2013/14 Barclays Premier League fixture list and pick out just some of the key matches that lie ahead. We speak exclusively to the recently retired, Phil Neville, about the significant changes at his two former clubs, Everton and Manchester United. Former Wales international, John Hartson, joins us to discuss the buoyant state of Welsh football with Cardiff joining rivals Swansea in the top flight. Plus we talk about the numerous managerial changes that have taken place since May, hearing from Jose Mourinho, Roberto Martinez and Mark Hughes.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2012-13 - Episode 40 - Review of the Season
item.itunes:summary: Review of the Season. Iain Dowie and Matt Jackson join Dave Farrar to review what has been an enthralling season topped off by Sir Alex Ferguson winning his 13th and final Barclays Premier League title. We hear from the Manchester United boss who brought an end to his remarkable 26 year reign at the club and we speak to one of his former players Dion Dublin. At the other end of the table, Wigan became the third and final team to be relegated, along with Reading and QPR, we hear from all three camps as well as talk exclusively to Norwich defender Russell Martin after a strong end to their season. Plus we discuss the dramatic race for 4th place between Arsenal and Spurs

Iain Dowie and Matt Jackson join Dave Farrar to review what has been an enthralling season topped off by Sir Alex Ferguson winning his 13th and final Barclays Premier League title. We hear from the Manchester United boss who brought an end to his remarkable 26 year reign at the club and we speak to one of his former players Dion Dublin. At the other end of the table, Wigan became the third and final team to be relegated, along with Reading and QPR, we hear from all three camps as well as talk exclusively to Norwich defender Russell Martin after a strong end to their season. Plus we discuss the dramatic race for 4th place between Arsenal and Spurs

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2012-13 - Preview of the Season
item.itunes:summary: In this special Preview of the Season, Dave Farrar is joined by two special guests â€“ former Arsenal defender Nigel Winterburn and Tottenham and Liverpool defender John Scales. Together they take a detailed look ahead to the coming Barclays Premier League season and discuss whats been a busy summer of transfer activity. We hear from Roberto Mancini, Sir Alex Ferguson, Arsene Wenger and Petr Cech as well from the new managerial recruits of Andre Villas Boas, Brendan Rodgers, Paul Lambert, Steve Clarke and Chris Hughton. We speak exclusively to newly promoted West Ham manager, Sam Allardyce as he makes a return to the top flight. And continuing our Fan of the Week section from last season, we talk to a Manchester United fan in Hyderabad in India who was the most recent Barclays Home Winner.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Review of the Season
item.itunes:summary: In this special final episode of the season Iain Dowie and Matt Jackson join Dave Farrar to look back on what has been a truly remarkable Barclays Premier League season with a fitting end as Manchester City scored twice in injury time to clinch their first top flight title in 44 years, we hear from an ecstatic City camp as well as get reaction from a deflated United squad. At the other end of the table, QPR survived by the skin of their teeth as Bolton could only draw at Stoke, meaning that they joined Blackburn and Wolves in the bottom three, we have reaction from all parties involved. Arsenal and Spurs edged out Newcastle to take 3rd and 4th spots respectively and we hear from Wenger, Redknapp and Manager of the Year, Alan Pardew. Plus we review how all the other teams fared in this seasonâ€™s Barclays Premier League. And in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a Manchester City supporter about the sheer relief of finishing top of the pile at the end of arguably the Barclays Premier Leagues greatest ever season.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Episode 40
item.itunes:summary: Former Chelsea and Aston Villa striker, Tony Cascarino, joins Dave Farrar to reflect on what looks like one hand on the Trophy for Roberto Mancinis Manchester City after their 2-0 win against Newcastle. We hear more from both camps as well as the Blackburn manager Steve Kean after his sides to defeat to Wigan sent them down to the Championship. We discuss the other teams fighting for survival at the bottom of the table as well as look at the battle for the Champions League spots at the top, hearing from all those clubs involved. And in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a QPR supporter about their hopes of beating the dreaded drop.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Episode 39
item.itunes:summary: Former Chelsea midfielder, Craig Burley, joins Jim Proudfoot to reflect on what could be the decisive moment of this seasons title race as City emerged victorious over United in the Manchester derby to reclaim top spot with just 2 games to go, we hear from Roberto Mancini, Sir Alex Ferguson and match winner Vincent Kompany as well as talk to Chief Sports Writer of the Daily Mirror, Ollie Holt, who witnessed the action unfold at the Etihad on Monday night. At the other end of the table, Wigan continued their sensational recent form with a 4-0 victory over Newcastle and we speak exclusively to their manager, Roberto Martinez. We discuss the other teams fighting for survival at the bottom of the table as well as look at the battle for 4th spot at the top, hearing from all those clubs involved. And in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a Bolton supporter about their hopes of beating the dreaded drop.

We talk exclusively to former QPR midfielder Marc Bircham about their relegation battle, and also to Sunderland defender Matt Kilgallon on Martin Oâ€™Neills impact at the club. And in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a Newcastle supporter from Malaysia.

item.itunes:summary: Former Liverpool, Spurs and Manchester City striker, Paul Walsh, joins Dave Farrar to reflect on another dramatic weekend of Barclays Premier League action including two resounding wins for the Manchester clubs, United at home to Villa and City away at Norwich, where a certain returning Argentine made a big impact. We hear from Roberto Mancini on Carlos Tevez as well as get the thoughts of renowned football journalist Sam Wallace on the title race. And in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a delighted Wigan supporter after their remarkable win at Arsenal on Monday night.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Episode 29
item.itunes:summary: This week Dave Farrar is joined by two special guests, former Arsenal midfielder, Stewart Robson and ex Republic of Ireland international, Matt Holland. Together they look ahead to what is sure to be a fascinating final third of the Barclays Premier League season, discussing the fight for the title, the race for that coveted 4th spot and of course the battle for Barclays Premier League survival. We hear from the title chasing trio of Sir Alex Ferguson, James Milner and Harry Redknapp as well as from the under pressure Arsene Wenger, Owen Coyle and Roberto Martinez. Former Chelsea midfielder, Graham Stuart, joins us to discuss the current pressures piling on manager Andres Villas Boas at Stamford Bridge. And in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a Manchester City supporter from Chennai in India.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Episode 28
item.itunes:summary: Former Everton, Wigan and Norwich defender, Matt Jackson, joins Dave Farrar to review another eventful weekend of Barclays Premier League action, which saw Mick McCarthy become the third managerial casualty of the season after his Wolves side were humiliated 5-1 at home by local rivals West Brom, we hear from McCarthy as well as get the opinions of former Wolves favourite Don Goodman. We hear from Wayne Rooney after another feisty Manchester United v Liverpool encounter as well as from Andre Villas Boas, Thierry Henry and Mark Hughes. We speak exclusively to Wigan captain, Gary Caldwell, after their crucial win at Bolton. And in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a Spurs supporter about the ongoing Harry Redknapp saga.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Episode 18
item.itunes:summary: Former West Ham and Charlton manager, Alan Curbishley joins Dave Farrar and together they take a look back at Manchester Citys relentless charge to the title and a look ahead to a new era at Sunderlands Stadium of Light. John Hartson tells us just what it is about Martin ONeill that makes him such a successful manager. We speak exclusively to Blackburns Morten Gamst Pedersen after three much needed points at the weekend. Well also hear from Didier Drogba, Phil Jones, Harry Redknapp and a disgruntled Neil Warnock and in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to an increasingly optimistic Spurs supporter from Singapore.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Episode 17
item.itunes:summary: Former Chelsea midfielder, Craig Burley, joins Dave Farrar and together they look back at another weekend of Barclays Premier League action where Manchester City maintained their unbeaten record at the top of the table with a hard fought point at Anfield. We speak exclusively to Newcastle defender Steven Taylor after their superb point at Old Trafford as well as talk to Peter Reid about the current situation at Sunderland. We hear from Andre Villas Boas, David Moyes, and Tony Pulis and in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a Liverpool supporter in Bangalore in India.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Episode 16
item.itunes:summary: Former Arsenal midfielder, Stewart Robson, joins Jim Proudfoot to take a look back at another gripping weekend of Barclays Premier League action including a 3-3 thriller at the DW Stadium between the leagues bottom two, Wigan and Blackburn, we hear from a disgruntled Roberto Martinez as well as from Harry Redknapp, Arsene Wenger, Neil Warnock and many others. We speak exclusively to former Liverpool defender John Scales about his old sides dramatic win at Stamford Bridge. And in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a Manchester City supporter in New Zealand.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Episode 15
item.itunes:summary: This week Dave Farrar is joined by two special guests, former QPR striker Iain Dowie, and ex Everton, Wigan and Norwich defender, Matt Jackson. Together, they look back at the first 11 Barclays Premier League games of the season and pick their Teams of the Season so far, with some surprising choices! We speak exclusively to Wolves defender, Richard Stearman, about their up and down start to the campaign as well as hear from Roberto Mancini, Robin Van Persie and Scott Parker. And in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a Newcastle supporter in Australia ahead of their showdown with Manchester City this weekend, the only two remaining unbeaten sides in the league.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Episode 14
item.itunes:summary: Former QPR striker and manager, Iain Dowie, joins Dave Farrar to look back at a landmark weekend which saw Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson celebrate 25 years at Old Trafford, we hear from Sir Alex as well as get the views of former United and England midfielder, Ray Wilkins. We also hear from Roberto Martinez, Mick McCarthy, Edin Dzeko and an evergreen Brad Friedel after another eventful weekend of Barclays Premier League action. And in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a Blackburn supporter about the ever increasing pressure on manager Steve Kean.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Episode 13
item.itunes:summary: Former Charlton and Republic of Ireland midfielder, Matt Holland, joins Dave Farrar to look back at another dramatic weekend of Barclays Premier League action which saw 39 goals scored, including an 8 goal thriller at Stamford Bridge between Chelsea and Arsenal, we get reaction from that remarkable match and talk to former Arsenal defender Nigel Winterburn about the Gunners upturn in form. We also speak exclusively to Blackburn midfielder Morten Gamst Pedersen about their heart breaking draw at Norwich, as well as hear from Sir Alex Ferguson, Harry Redknapp and Roberto Martinez. Plus in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a Bolton supporter about what are becoming troubling times at the Reebok.

item.itunes:summary: This week Jim Proudfoot is joined by two special guests, former Arsenal midfielder, Stewart Robson, and ex Norwich striker, Efan Ekoku. Together, they look back at what has been a fascinating first seven games of the season, discussing the highs and the lows and hearing from the likes of Arsene Wenger, MicK McCarthy, Ledley King and Gabriel Obertan. Plus in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a disbelieving Newcastle supporter in Londonâ€¦.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Episode 9
item.itunes:summary: Ian Payne is joined by former Arsenal and West Ham defender, Nigel Winterburn, and together they look back at another entertaining weekend of action including two heated derbies, neither short of controversial refereeing decisions, we hear from David Moyes and Arsene Wenger, as well as from Frank Lampard, Martin Jol and an under pressure Steve Kean. We speak exclusively to Newcastle defender, Danny Simpson, about their unbeaten start to the season as well as talk to West Brom defender, Nicky Shorey about their tricky start so far. And, in our Fan of the Week Section we talk to a Swansea City supporter in.... Cardiff!

item.itunes:summary: This week Ian Payne is joined by two special guests, former West Ham and Charlton manager, Alan Curbishley, and ex QPR striker Iain Dowie. Plus in our Fan of the Week section we talk to Spurs supporter on the West coast of Scotlandâ€¦.

item.itunes:summary: This week Dave Farrar is joined by former Arsenal midfielder, Stewart Robson, and ex Liverpool, Spurs and Man City striker, Paul Walsh. Together they discuss all the big stories from the third week of the Barclays Premier League season, including two truly extraordinary results on Sunday where the two Manchester clubs completely outclassed their North London counterparts. We hear from a resolute Arsene Wenger and a sympathetic Sir Alex Ferguson as well as from Harry Redknapp, Edin Dzeko and Kenny Dalglish. We talk to former Spurs centre back Gary Oâ€™Reilly about the current troubles at White Hart Lane and in our Fan of the Week section we talk to a passionate Everton fan from Australia.

item.title: Official Barclays Premier League Podcast 2011-12 - Episode 3
item.itunes:summary: This week Dave Farrar and the former Everton, Wigan and Norwich defender Matt Jackson discuss all the big stories from the second week of the Barclays Premier League season. Sir Alex Ferguson tells how his young players are forcing their way into the Manchester United first team. We chat exclusively to the QPR manager Neil Warnock on how hes enjoying life back in the top flight. We get an insight into the pressures at the bottom of the table with Blackburn striker Jason Roberts and former Manchester City defender Danny Mills explains why he thinks Roberto Mancini still needs to buy more players. As always theres our trivia teaser and this week we speak to an Arsenal fan from Nepal.

Ray Parlour gives us his insight into what is going on at Arsenal, former USA and Wolves goalkeeper Marcus Hahnemann discusses Manchester Uniteds struggling new recruit, David De Gea, and we speak exclusively to Wigan midfielder, and scorer on the opening weekend, Ben Watson.
